thread.title: Tim Tebow a running back? Madden 16 thinks it's a good idea
thread.title_full: Tim Tebow a running back? Madden 16 thinks it's a good idea - The Denver Post

author: Joe Nguyen
title: Tim Tebow a running back? Madden 16 thinks it's a good idea
text:
Listen, I know Tim Tebow really, really wants to play quarterback, but hear me out. Tim Tebow: running back.
While playing Madden NFL 16 , I noticed if you change Tebow's position to halfback, he earns a sizable bump in his overall rating.
Madden uses a scale of 0-100 but typically average players range in the mid-70s. So rather than Tebow being a subpar quarterback with a rating of 68, he becomes a mid-tier running back with a score of 75.
At 6-foot-3 and 236 pounds, he would be a big bruising power back. Think Peyton Hillis without the blocking abilty. His 83 strength is ranked near the best among RBs, as is his ball carrier vision (95), which is tied with the likes of Eddie Lacy, DeMarco Murray and Darren Sproles.
To test this theory, I needed to sign the free agent to a team. So why not the Broncos? Denver's in need of some depth at the position and Tebow's rating was No. 2 between C.J. Anderson and Ronnie Hillman. But I'm making him the starter, you know, for science. And sorry, Kyle Williams, but we're going to need that No. 15 jersey back.
To make it fair, every game was simulated and injuries turned off (I mean, reading about Tebow sitting on the bench after getting hurt after Week 1 would be incredibly dull).
So how'd he do?
Running behind Denver's inexperienced line, he struggled early in the season, running for less than 4.0 yards per carry in each of his first two games. He finally broke out in Week 4, exploding for 91 yards on the ground and tallying two touchdowns against the Vikings.
Advertisement Oh yes, Tebowmania has returned to Denver.
It doesn't stop there. Tebow broke 100 yards for the first time against the Raiders' defense in Week 4 and recorded his first TD reception. It was the turning point of the season for him.
Whatcha goin' do when Tebowmania runs wild on you?!
The Broncos finished 12-4 and earned a wild-card berth (KC won the division, in case you were wondering). As for Tebow? The former QB rushed for 1,364 yards and nine TDs. He ran in four TDs in two playoff games before Denver fell to the Bengals. Despite his effort, no postseason awards, but he brought back the art of Tebowing to the Mile High City.
C'mon, Tim. Running back. Consider it.
